revised_title: Elastic Contact Theory for Nominally Flat Surfaces
tldr: The authors present a new mathematical model for elastic contact between nominally flat surfaces, considering the topography of the surfaces and the probability of contact at asperities. They find that the real area of contact is directly proportional to the load and independent of the apparent area, and that surfaces which touch elastically are not uncommon in engineering practice. The theory also indicates the existence of an elastic contact hardness, a composite quantity that plays a role in elastic contact similar to the conventional hardness in plastic contact.
